meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of rubble.
meanings.sent1: The old building was rubblier after the earthquake.
meanings.sent2: The construction site looked rubblier with all the broken bricks and stones.
meanings.sent3: The kids made a fort out of the rubblier pieces of the demolished house.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt rubblier than the ruins of the ancient castle.
meanings.sent5: The rubblier path was difficult to walk on, with rocks and debris everywhere.

meanings.sent1: The new road was rubblier than the old one, with larger rocks scattered around.
meanings.sent2: The beach became rubblier as the tide brought in more pebbles and shells.
meanings.sent3: The rubblier terrain made it challenging for the hikers to find a smooth path.
meanings.sent4: His voice sounded rubblier as he spoke louder to be heard over the noise.
meanings.sent5: The rubblier texture of the wall gave it a unique and rugged appearance.
